channel.title: 10£/16$ VPS Deal
channel.description:
You get: Dual Core Intel Processor 12MB L2 Cache, 2.8GHz 128MB of RAM 10GB HDD 200GB Bandwidth/mo 1 IPv4 IP 8 IPv6 IPs
They accept PayPal, among other things. Instant setup.
Download: [code] root@le:~# wget http://cachefly.cachefly.net/100mb.test -O /dev/null --2011-11-11 03:21:31-- http://cachefly.cachefly.net/100mb.test Resolving cachefly.cachefly.net... 205.234.175.175 Connecting to cachefly.cachefly.net|205.234.175.175|:80... connected. HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK Length: 104857600 (100M) [application/octet-stream] Saving to: `/dev/null'
100%[======================================>] 104,857,600 57.1M/s in 1.8s
2011-11-11 03:21:33 (57.1 MB/s) - `/dev/null' saved [104857600/104857600] [/code]
Just bought one, along with TehSpede and vortex.
Link (make sure to NOT choose the $100+ cpanel option): [code] https://www.qualityservers.co.uk/cp/cart.php?a=add&pid=150 [/code]

item.title: 10£/16$ VPS Deal
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Thanks for clearing that up, I was curious.

I grabbed one of those $7/month 2gb seems-too-good-to-be-true ChicagoVPS boxes to run a beta of MoparClassic off of. I ran some of those test scripts people were linking to and got really good results, it should work fine for a beta, and I guess only time will tell if it’s a “pump and dump”.

Read full topic

item.title: 10£/16$ VPS Deal
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:119, topic:421224”][quote author=c|p link=topic=523888.msg3883643#msg3883643 date=1326249549]

Anyone know any decent VPS providers?

http://alienvps.com/

[/quote]

Just read this on lowendbox.com:

http://www.lowendbox.com/blog/dead-pool-december-2011/:

vpsVIBE

Current Status: IP address not resolvable

vpsVIBE came into scene in June 2011 selling 512MB OpenVZ VPS for $5.95. Like how it has been commented in this WHT thread, it’s just another pump and dump scheme from those who previously ran AlienVPS (bailed out by WebRulon) and GenVPS (bailed out by GigaTux). Don’t you worry that they have done a running — they’ll probably soon respawn in yet another low end VPS provider somewhere.

Are we talking about the same AlienVPS here?[/quote]

I’m not sure, I can ask about it.

Edit:

c`p | i recommended alienvps in a thread on mitb c`p | and uh c`p | http://www.webhostingtalk.com/showthread.php?t=1106056 c`p | this came up c`p | that is, someone posted it c`p | also http://www.lowendbox.com/blog/dead-pool-december-2011/ c`p | 'Like how it has been commented in this WHT thread, it???s just another pump and dump scheme from those who previously ran AlienVPS (bailed out by WebRulon) and GenVPS (bailed out by GigaTux).' c`p | got any info on that? c`p | they say ex-alienvps team though c`p | so im guessing that means that the current owners have the intention of c`p | not scrapping it? [i]redacted[/i] | yes [i]redacted[/i] | we bought it like 2yr ago c`p | who were the old people [i]redacted[/i] | john tambourine or something like that c`p | ah, yeah someone mentioned a jtam in that wht thread c`p | so webrulon owns it now? [i]redacted[/i] | yeah c`p | ok, that makes sense now c`p | do you mind if i post htis in that thread on mitb [i]redacted[/i] | yeah go ahead [i]redacted[/i] | it's fine

Some examples of this guy jtam’s work (from a comment on the lowendbox.com post):

john tamburino’s crap list: 720leap – shared – current pump and dump vpsvibe – vps – dumped and dead radicalbro – shared – dumped and dead boxselect – random crap – down alienrack – dumped, moved to webrulon alienvps – dumped, moved to webrulon hostsiege – shared – dumped and dead

So, yes, this is the same AlienVPS, however it is no longer owned by jtam. WebRulon is fairly large I think and AlienVPS has been owned by them for a while now. I would say your $19 is safe.

Read full topic

item.title: 10£/16$ VPS Deal
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Dear Client,

We’ve had some tickets from concerned clients about their data being grabbed by other people who have guessed their hostname. Whilst I think this is an extremely unlikely scenario given there are no obvious or duplicate hostnames, I have updated the files as follows:

[hostname].img has become:
[vmid]-[hostname].img

The vmid can be found in SolusVM and looks something like vm100 or vm250 etc. Also feel free to request that your file be deleted after you have dowloaded it.

Many thanks

No shit sherlock.

Read full topic

Just read this on lowendbox.com:

vpsVIBE

Current Status: IP address not resolvable

vpsVIBE came into scene in June 2011 selling 512MB OpenVZ VPS for $5.95. Like how it has been commented in this WHT thread, it’s just another pump and dump scheme from those who previously ran AlienVPS (bailed out by WebRulon) and GenVPS (bailed out by GigaTux). item.title: 10£/16$ VPS Deal
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The best way to safeguard your client’s sensitive data would of course be to put it up for public download to anyone who knows or can guess the hostname right? Nice one QVPS.

Dear Client

If you had data on the XM11 server, now is the time to retrieve it. Instructions as below:

The image files are copies of your logical volume. If you are moving to a Xen VPS with another provider, it will be easiest to provide them with your individual link and have them restore your data onto a new VPS. If not, you will need to download your image file and mount it.

To get your download link, you will need your hostname from the old server as in SolusVM and use it as follows:

http://31.193.8.207:90/xm11/[hostname].img

So if your hostname is server.domain.com, your link would be http://31.193.8.207:90/xm11/server.domain.com.img.

Be aware that these files are very large (up to 100GB each) and might take some time to download. To save time you can wget them to another server.

We will keep these links active until 31/01.

Read full topic

item.title: 10£/16$ VPS Deal
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“c|p, post:102, topic:421224”]I would say they are good. Pretty decent support, has pretty much all the necessary things available in the control panel (mostly SolusVM, although there is another part in WHMCS). I’ve known someone for a long time who has been working there for a while, and I can say the people there are good at what they do.

I suppose if you get a $19/yr VPS though, you can’t really ask for too much more :)[/quote]

It looks like they have only been open at that website since may though, was it under another name before?

And yes, if I got the $19/yr VPS, all I would ask is that I would actually have it for a year, none of this “closed, we will now try to refund you partially” ridiculousness.

[quote=“Ollie, post:106, topic:421224”]If you want decent vps, you will have to pay for it I guess.

https://www.gandi.net/hosting/vps#main-nav[/quote]

Do you or anyone you know have experience with them? “You get what you pay for” is a good guideline, but also just because something is more money doesn’t mean it’s better.

Read full topic
